title: Moore’s 10-point plan to stop Trump
text:
Share on Twitter 
DONALD Trump is in deep trouble and it won’t take much for the US President to be brought down. 
Just one month into his presidency, Mr Trump has been hit by a series of snags and a lot of backlash and it’s clear the American people aren’t happy. 
At least that’s the view of controversial filmmaker Michael Moore who has devised a 10 point plan people can follow to stop Donald Trump. 
In a post shared to his Facebook page, the Fahrenheit 9/11 director and renowned Trump critic said things weren’t going that well for the President so far. 
Not only is he in the “pocket of Russians” but he is “surrounded by alt-right idiots, alone in his bathrobe in a mostly-empty White House,” Moore claimed. 
In a clear reference to the New York Times expose on how Mr Trump reportedly spends his time in the White House , Moore writes that momentum is already building against the President. 
The director and producer then goes on to mention those who have already “stormed Congressional district offices and town hall meetings to express their rage at the Trump agenda” as well as four federal courts ruling against the immigration ban which targeted seven Muslim majority countries. 
According to Moore, progressive Democrat Keith Ellison looks set to win Saturday’s vote to head the Democratic Party. This spells bad news for Mr Trump because he’s likely to “fix the party” which is in desperate need of an overhaul. 
This in turn means there is unlikely to be a repeat of the party’s disastrous performance last year. Moore writes momentum is building against President Trump. Picture: Sail Loeb Source: AFP 
Moore also writes how the country’s comedians are helping to turn the tide with press secretary Sean Spicer reportedly furious about being impersonated by Melissa McCarthy which “has Trump fuming to the point where he has considered getting rid of him”. 
In the Facebook post, the filmmaker, who successfully predicted Mr Trump would win the presidency said by following his simple steps, voters could “make Trump toast”. 
The first thing people need to do is make a daily call to Congress, something Moore said took two minutes and could be part of a morning routine. 
Moore said politicians will be annoyed by this because they can’t even handle 10 calls a day let alone 100,000 and encouraged them to list everything they wanted changed since Mr Trump took office. 
He then goes on to encourage people to turn up as part of a monthly visit, or even visit them in Washington. Michael Moore, pictured during the Women’s March on Washington last month, has encouraged people to keep on marching. Picture: Theo Wargo/Getty Images Source: Getty Images 
The third point Moore makes is that people should form their own rapid response teams so they can be ready to jump into action ready to protest like many Americans did in the wake of the “Muslim ban”. 
Moore also encourages people to join some national groups including Planned Parenthood or Black Lives Matter and called on people to keep marching like millions did in January when the Women’s March took place in Washington. 
In his sixth point, Moore encourages people to take over the Democratic Party because the old leadership has to go, asking how “we have won the popular vote in six of the seven last presidential elections and yet hold no power?” 
The seventh thing to do, he writes, is for people to live in blue states to show the rest of the country how it’s done and what it looks like when Mr Trump isn’t in charge. New York could offer free college education while Hawaii can enact its own climate change laws, he writes. 
The next thing to do is run for office because “Congress needs people like you” and the only way to fix things is to get in there and do it yourself. 
His last two points include becoming the media by using the internet to promote your own empire by sharing information while encouraging people to join the army of comedians taking aim at the President. 
“Trump’s Achilles heel is his massively thin skin. He can’t take mockery. So we all need to MOCK HIM UP!,” he writes in his last point, adding the President won’t be able to take it.
